edge: Both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, were adapted from the book sequels and produced by Michael De Luca Productions in 2016. They were shot back-to-back due to the continuity of the storyline.

node_2: fifty shades darker and fifty shades freed
edge: James Foley directed both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, which were shot back-to-back in 2016.

node_2: fifty shades darker and fifty shades freed
edge: Niall Leonard wrote the script for both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.

node_2: fifty shades darker and fifty shades freed
edge: Michael De Luca and Dana Brunetti returned to produce both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.

node_2: fifty shades darker and fifty shades freed
edge: E. L. James, the author of the book series, was also involved in producing both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.

node_2: fifty shades darker and fifty shades freed
edge: Dakota Johnson reprised her role as Ana in both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.

node_2: fifty shades darker and fifty shades freed
edge: Jamie Dornan also returned to his role as Christian Grey in both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.
Arielle Kebbel was cast to play the character of Gia Matteo, a beautiful architect hired by Christian to build his home in Fifty Shades Darker.
Eric Johnson was cast as Jack Hyde, Ana's boss at SIP and a stalker, in Fifty Shades Darker.
Brant Daugherty was signed on to play the role of Sawyer, Christian's personal bodyguard for Ana, in Fifty Shades Darker.
Both films, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, will be shot back-to-back with principal photography scheduled to commence in early 2016.
In November 2015, Universal Studios announced that Fifty Shades Darker would be shot back-to-back with Fifty Shades Freed.
In November 2015, Universal Studios announced that Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed would be shot back-to-back.
